channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The Pentagon is removing thousands of transgender troops under Hegseth's anti-DEI push
item.description: As several global tensions simmer, the Pentagon is removing thousands of transgender troops under Sec.Hegseth's anti-DEI push. How might a focus on gender identity distract from mission readiness?
item.content:encoded: As several global tensions simmer, the Pentagon is removing thousands of transgender troops under Sec.Hegseth's anti-DEI push. How might a focus on gender identity distract from mission readiness?
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: Emily Nemens' novel 'Clutch' tells the story of 5 women and their lifelong friendship
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with author Emily Nemens about her latest novel, Clutch, which tells the story of five women and their lifelong friendship.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with author Emily Nemens about her latest novel, Clutch, which tells the story of five women and their lifelong friendship.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: An AI project is creating videos to go with Supreme Court justices' real words
item.description: The reading of Supreme Court opinions can only be seen by those inside the court. An AI project is trying to change that.
item.content:encoded: The reading of Supreme Court opinions can only be seen by those inside the court. An AI project is trying to change that.
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Bangladesh holds its first election since ousting its former leader
item.description: Bangladeshis go to the polls for the first time since they overthrew their former autocratic leader. Will voters trust the results?
item.content:encoded: Bangladeshis go to the polls for the first time since they overthrew their former autocratic leader. Will voters trust the results?
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: These monks' walk for peace captivated Americans. It ends this week
item.description: A group of Buddhist monks walked from Fort Worth, Texas, to Washington, D.C., in the name of peace. The 108-day pilgrimage captivated Americans.
item.content:encoded:
A group of Buddhist monks walked from Fort Worth, Texas, to Washington, D.C., in the name of peace. The 108-day pilgrimage captivated Americans.

(Image credit: Rahmat Gul)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: VA Secretary clashes with Democrats over details on VA re-organization
item.description: The secretary of Veterans Affairs testified before a house committee today for just the second time during the Trump administration, to explain a national plan to drastically streamline VA bureaucracy.
item.content:encoded: The secretary of Veterans Affairs testified before a house committee today for just the second time during the Trump administration, to explain a national plan to drastically streamline VA bureaucracy.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Bondi and House Democrats clash over Epstein files at DOJ oversight hearing
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi testified on Capitol Hill Wednesday before House lawmakers in a frequently combative hearing.
item.content:encoded: Attorney General Pam Bondi testified on Capitol Hill Wednesday before House lawmakers in a frequently combative hearing.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Group of refugees in Minnesota say Trump Administration is illegally detaining them
item.description: Refugees from three continents are suing the Department of Homeland Security, saying immigration agents illegally arrested and detained them as part of a Trump administration review of asylum seekers.
item.content:encoded: Refugees from three continents are suing the Department of Homeland Security, saying immigration agents illegally arrested and detained them as part of a Trump administration review of asylum seekers.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: For many doctors and patients in Minneapolis, medical care has moved underground
item.description: The Trump administration's immigration enforcement operation in Minneapolis has pushed many immigrant communities away from hospitals and doctors. Some have responded with underground clinics.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration's immigration enforcement operation in Minneapolis has pushed many immigrant communities away from hospitals and doctors. Some have responded with underground clinics.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Norwegian Johannes Klaebo has a shot at winning all 6 events in cross-country skiing
item.description: A Norwegian cross-country skier is on track to become the winningest winter Olympian ever. Johannes Klaebo is a talent the likes of which the world has never seen.
item.content:encoded: A Norwegian cross-country skier is on track to become the winningest winter Olympian ever. Johannes Klaebo is a talent the likes of which the world has never seen.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Herz
